intro: Clidemia rodriguezii, commonly known as the Rodriguez's mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
